questions.question: Once you have created the process flowchart, what would be the next step? (Questions 1-3 are related to a process flowchart as shown on Sollecito & Johnson, pp. 94-95.) Select all that apply:

Are there equipment, staff, or regulatory constraints?
Chart each step in finer detail.

questions.question: Look at the chart displayed on the monitor. The housekeeping department has a benchmark standard of two hours to clean a room. Is the housekeeping department achieving this benchmark?
choices: No, because there are extreme variables outside the control limits.
Not possible to tell without calculating the average length of time per room cleaned.
Not possible to tell because this chart does not show when cleaning commences.
Yes, because the data are under control.
answers: Not possible to tell without calculating the average length of time per room cleaned.

questions.question: Using the Six Sigma methodology for eliminating defects and reducing variability, what is the defect that this quality improvement exercise is intended to improve?
choices: The length of time after a patient is discharged before housekeeping is notified.
The length of time it takes for housekeeping to prepare a recently vacated patient room.
The length of time an admitted patient must wait in the ED until a bed is available.
The variability in length of time between when a patient is discharged and when a room is cleaned.
answers: The length of time an admitted patient must wait in the ED until a bed is available.
questions.feedback: That is the defect in patient outcome.
